title: New Jersey National Guard Tuition Program (NJNGTP)
summary: FREE tuition for up to 16 credits per semester at 29 New Jersey public institutions for National Guard members in good standing. Covers both undergraduate and graduate programs. This is a last-dollar benefit after Pell Grants and TAG, and cannot be combined with Federal Tuition Assistance.

requirements.notes: Apply through New Jersey Army National Guard education office. Must be approved before enrollment each semester.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Active New Jersey National Guard member in good standing Enrolled at participating New Jersey public institution Cannot be receiving Federal Tuition Assistance concurrently
Benefit: FREE tuition - 16 credits per semester at public institutions
How to apply: Apply through New Jersey Army National Guard education office. Must be approved before enrollment each semester.

title: Vietnam Veterans Tuition Credit Program
summary: $400 per year tuition credit for eligible Vietnam-era veterans attending New Jersey institutions of higher education.

requirements.notes: Contact institution's financial aid office or New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Vietnam-era veteran New Jersey resident Attending New Jersey institution of higher education
Benefit: $400 per academic year
How to apply: Contact institution's financial aid office or New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs

title: POW/MIA Dependents Tuition Waiver
summary: FREE tuition at New Jersey public colleges and universities for children of veterans who were prisoners of war or declared missing in action.

requirements.notes: Apply through New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs with POW/MIA documentation

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Child of New Jersey veteran who was POW or MIA New Jersey resident Attending New Jersey public institution
Benefit: FREE tuition at NJ public institutions
How to apply: Apply through New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs with POW/MIA documentation

title: War Orphans Tuition Assistance
summary: $500 per year for up to 4 years for children of veterans who died or became totally disabled while serving during wartime or peacetime service.

requirements.notes: Apply through New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Child of New Jersey veteran who died or became totally disabled during service New Jersey resident Attending approved educational institution
Benefit: $500 per year for up to 4 years ($2,000 total)
How to apply: Apply through New Jersey Department of Military and Veterans Affairs

title: 100% Disabled Veterans Property Tax Exemption
summary: 100% property tax exemption for veterans who are 100% permanently and totally disabled (P&T) as certified by the VA. Exemption applies to primary residence.

requirements.notes: 100% service-connected, total and permanent disabled veteran; primary residence. Apply through local tax assessor.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident veteran 100% permanent and total VA disability rating Property is primary residence
Benefit: 100% property tax exemption on primary residence
How to apply: File annually with local tax assessor with VA certification letter

title: Disabled Veterans Property Tax Deduction
summary: Proportional property tax exemption based on disability rating (30-90%). Veterans with service-connected disabilities receive deductions up to $10,000 in assessed property value.

requirements.notes: Service-connected disability rating between 30% and 90% (per NJ program). Apply through local tax assessor.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident veteran Service-connected disability rating of 30% or higher Property is primary residence
Benefit: Proportional deduction based on disability rating - up to $10,000 assessed value
How to apply: Apply annually with local tax assessor showing VA disability rating

title: Standard Veterans Property Tax Deduction
summary: $250 annual property tax deduction available to ALL honorably discharged veterans who are New Jersey residents.

requirements.notes: Annual $250 property tax deduction for qualifying veterans/surviving spouses. Apply through local tax assessor.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Honorably discharged veteran New Jersey resident Property owner
Benefit: $250 annual property tax deduction
How to apply: File with local tax assessor with DD-214

title: Veterans Income Tax Exemption
summary: Income tax exemption for veterans ranging from $3,000 to $6,000 based on disability rating and other qualifying factors.

requirements.notes: Claim on New Jersey income tax return with supporting documentation

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident veteran Honorable discharge Meets income requirements
Benefit: $3,000 to $6,000 income tax exemption
How to apply: Claim on New Jersey income tax return with supporting documentation

title: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
summary: Military retirement pay is fully exempt from New Jersey state income tax for all military retirees.

requirements.notes: Exclude military retirement from New Jersey tax return

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Receiving military retirement pay New Jersey resident
Benefit: 100% exemption on all military retirement income
How to apply: Exclude military retirement from New Jersey tax return

title: Veterans Absolute Employment Preference
summary: Absolute preference in hiring for New Jersey state government positions for qualified veterans. Veterans receive priority consideration over non-veterans with equal qualifications.

requirements.notes: Civil Service veterans preference; disabled veterans may receive highest preference. See NJ DMAVA guidance.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: Honorably discharged veteran New Jersey resident Meets minimum qualifications for position
Benefit: Absolute hiring preference for state positions
How to apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications and provide DD-214

title: Free State Parks Admission
summary: Free admission to New Jersey state parks for disabled veterans with valid veteran identification.

requirements.notes: NJ residents who are totally disabled may qualify for a free Disability State Park Pass; not limited to veterans.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident veteran Service-connected disability Valid veteran ID or disability documentation
Benefit: Free admission to all NJ state parks
How to apply: Present veteran ID and disability documentation at park entrance

title: Free Private Beach Access for Disabled Veterans
summary: Free access to certain private beaches in New Jersey for disabled veterans during summer season.

requirements.notes: NJ disabled veterans may qualify for free or reduced-fee beach-related access programs (e.g., Island Beach State Park MSFV permit). Eligibility varies by program.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident Service-connected disability Participating beach locations
Benefit: Free beach access at participating locations
How to apply: Check with individual municipalities for participating beaches and required documentation

title: Disabled Veterans Hunting and Fishing License Benefits
summary: Reduced-fee or free hunting and fishing licenses for disabled veterans based on disability rating.

requirements.notes: NJ resident, honorably discharged, VA service-connected disability (any degree). Initial certification required by NJ Fish & Wildlife.

eligibilityNotes:
Eligibility: New Jersey resident veteran Service-connected disability VA disability rating documentation
Benefit: Reduced fees or free licenses based on disability rating
How to apply: Apply through New Jersey Fish and Wildlife with VA disability documentation
